name: Boiled Coke with Ginger and Lemon
description: Boiled Coke with ginger and lemon started off as a popular cold remedy in Hong Kong, but now it's a popular anytime drink that's found at pretty much all Hong Kong diners. As a first-time, not sick drinker, I found it surprisingly pleasant. The cold and fizzy are gone, but you're left with sweet, spicy, a little tart, a smidge medicinal—all things that would feel restorative on a cold day or in a stream of warmth going down a sore throat.
recipeIngredient: 1 inch chunk ginger, peeled and thinly sliced

recipeInstructions.text: Add coke, ginger, and lemon to a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat, then adjust heat to maintain an active simmer. Simmer until reduced by 15 to 20 percent, 5 to 10 minutes. Pour into cup (through a fine mesh strainer if desired). Let cool at room temperature for a few minutes and serve.
